title: Taron Egerton breaks silence on Wolverine rumours
text:
Taron Egerton reacts to Wolverine rumours (Picture: Rex)

Will Taron Egerton be taking on the role of Wolverine?

One thing is for sure, the Rocketman isn’t letting up on the rumours just yet, teasing that he’s ‘baffled’ by all the hearsay.

With Disney now owning Fox, the X-Men can now enter into Marvel’s Cinematic Universe, leaving room for a brand new actor to replace Hugh Jackman as the clawed-mutant hero.

The rumour-mill has been running wild with talks that Egerton, who played alongside Jackman in the movie Eddie The Eagle, is next in line for the coming X-Men character.

But after finally responding to the news, we’re still none-the-wiser as to whether or not the 29-year-old actor will be picking up the mantel.

Speaking at ACE Comic Con in Chicago, the star said: ‘I think that I love those films and I’ve got lots of friends who play roles in those films and they love it and they have a great time.

Taron is staying coy about all the rumours (Picture: Clint Spaulding/REX)

‘I think the Logan thing is really interesting. I’m slightly baffled by it, I’ve never felt like a Wolverine sort of guy.’

Whilst the Welsh actor may not feel best suited to the role physically yet, Egerton still gave fans a glimmer of hope that he might be ready to play the rugged character in a few years time, adding that he would ‘love’ to join the MCU.

He added: ‘I think that one’s a few years away. I know that Kevin [Feige’s] spoken about it being a few years away.

‘Maybe in a few years I’ll look rough enough for it. I’ve made no secret of the fact that I’m a fan of those fans and of course I would, I would love to be a part of them.’

Taron doesn’t think he’s ‘rough enough’ to play Wolverine yet (Picture: Moviestore/REX)

While Egerton might be staying tight-lipped about Wolverine, the Welshman is hoping to reprise his role as Eggsy in the final installment of the Kingsman franchise.

Taron, who credits the film as the kickstarter to his acting career, expressed ‘a great fondness’ to playing the role again.

‘I would like to do one more because frankly, I’d like to say goodbye to him [Eggsy] in a befitting way and to finish the trilogy. All good things come to an end.

‘It was always imagined as a trilogy and I think it’d be great to finish the story off because I’ve loved playing the character.’

Guess we’ll have to wait a little while until we hear news of either movies, eh Taron?
